function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Contamination from unoccupied room with broad ieq conditions","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of misleading data due to inaccurate baseline measurements and lack of self-calibration validity under certain conditions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to poor indoor air quality and increased risk of disease transmission","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High occupancy density leading to increased risk of disease spread and infection","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient cleaning and sanitation leading to microbial contamination and disease transmission through fomites objects or surfaces","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Imbalance between supply and demand in thermal environment control","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overheating in the cold zone during winter","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient heating in the hscw zone during winter","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Continuous monitoring of indoor thermal performance throughout the year may increase the risk of spreading contagious diseases within the building","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in the hospital building may lead to high co2 concentrations, increasing the risk of disease transmission","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Elevated pm 2.5 concentrations in the hospital building may indicate poor indoor air quality, posing health risks to occupants","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Thermal discomfort in the offices may lead to reduced productivity and occupant dissatisfaction","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to high co2 concentrations in inpatient wards","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient air purification leading to high pm2.5 concentrations in various hospital areas","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Correlations between subjective and objective ieq data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Building occupants’ satisfaction and demands on ieq parameters are not studied under natural conditions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Indoor air and co2 concentration affect occupant satisfaction","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Differences in climate and hvac systems between northern and southern china affect thermal experiences and preferences","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Weak acceptance of cooler conditions in the northern group","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overcooling problem in buildings in northern china","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Narrow range of adaptation to thermal environment in winter for occupants in northern china","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differences in air quality satisfaction due to ventilation types in buildings in china","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Occupants may consider air quality unacceptable regardless of objective performance, leading to dissatisfaction and potential health risks","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lower acceptance for high co2 concentrations in building type a compared to building type b, leading to potential dissatisfaction and discomfort for occupants","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Comparison of different ieq monitoring tools and systems, which may result in the adoption of suboptimal systems and inadequate ieq management","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited sensor diversity in ibem may lead to incomplete monitoring of ieq parameters and potential health risks","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of sensor customization and flexibility in ibem limits its adaptability to different ieq monitoring scenarios","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited data flow and feedback interaction in ibem may hinder real-time adjustment of environmental parameters based on occupants’ needs and preferences","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of scientific and simplified deployment scheme for ibem","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Automatic linkage of ibem with environmental control system","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transformation of ibem deployment methodology from experience-based model to data-driven model","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contamination of the ibem hardware instrument with contagious pathogens or microbes","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate data security for the extensive ieq database","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate or misleading ieq data collection and transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The spread of covid-19 due to physical interaction and lack of lockdown measures","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of occupant presence and actions on building energy use","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High energy use in unoccupied buildings","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Energy performance gap in buildings","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of research on actual energy performance of buildings","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unoccupied buildings may still consume energy, leading to wastage and increased costs","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher ventilation rates required for occupants’ safety may lead to increased energy impact of social distancing measures on service energy consumption","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited impact of lockdown measures on energy use by
